import wandb

try:
    from kaggle_secrets import UserSecretsClient
    user_secrets = UserSecretsClient()
    api_key = user_secrets.get_secret("wandb_api")
    wandb.login(key=api_key)
    anony = None
except:
    anony = "must"
    print('If you want to use your W&B account, go to Add-ons -> Secrets and provide your W&B access token. Use the Label name as wandb_api. \nGet your W&B access token from here: https://wandb.ai/authorize')

source.7caab141:
Australia's stunningly beautiful Great Barrier Reef is the world’s largest coral reef and home to 1,500 species of fish, 400 species of corals, 130 species of sharks, rays, and a massive variety of other sea life. Unfortunately, the reef is under threat, in part because of the overpopulation of one particular starfish – the coral-eating crown-of-thorns starfish (or COTS for short). Scientists, tourism operators and reef managers established a large-scale intervention program to control COTS outbreaks to ecologically sustainable levels.Australia's stunningly beautiful Great Barrier Reef is the world’s largest coral reef and home to 1,500 species of fish, 400 species of corals, 130 species of sharks, rays, and a massive variety of other sea life. Unfortunately, the reef is under threat, in part because of the overpopulation of one particular starfish – the coral-eating crown-of-thorns starfish (or COTS for short). Scientists, tourism operators and reef managers established a large-scale intervention program to control COTS outbreaks to ecologically sustainable levels.
In this notebook we will visualize the images of the coral reefs along with the bounding boxes present in the dataset. They look beautiful!
source.3aec21bf:
Data Structure
  • video_id: ID number of the video the image was part of
  • video_frame: The frame number of the image within the video. Gaps might be present between frame numbers
  • sequence: ID of a gap-free subset of a given video
  • sequence_frame: The frame number within a given sequence
  • annotations: The bounding boxes of any starfish detections in string format. Contains x_min, y_min, width and height of the bounding box
source.1c6d5ec0:
Weights & Biases (W&B) is a set of machine learning tools that helps you build better models faster. Kaggle competitions require fast-paced model development and evaluation. There are a lot of components: exploring the training data, training different models, combining trained models in different combinations (ensembling), and so on. > ⏳ Lots of components = Lots of places to go wrong = Lots of time spent debugging Why use W&B tables? * Well suited for Quick EDA!
 * Let's you see the entire data
 * Filter, sort and group data which can help answer some fundamental questions.
 * Well suited to visualize model predictions and compare models
 To learn more about Weights and Biases Tables check out this colab notebook.
